decrease kw 19 p decrease how to double knit s n g is theory double knitting is knitting a fabric with two stockinette sides simultaneously on each row you e d are working alternating stitches from each side knitting one and purling the other e e t ic it casting on i prefer the ltco for double knitting for the twisted border cast on holding both yarns c e together a cast on of 21 means there will be actually 42 loops on the needle 21 for each side you lc e may need to fiddle with them a bit so that the two colors alternate on the needle s r e t s a o c a p p u c the two main things to remember t 1 stitches are counted in pairs each stitch is actually a pair of stitches one knit on the facing o h side and one purled on the far side 2 both strands of yarn are moved together even though you are only using one at a time both are held in back to knit and both come forward to purl designate your two colors as color a and color b there is no rs or ws to your work as it is reversible so you have side a where color a is the leading color and side b where color b is the leading color beginning on side a you slip the selvedge stitch and then with both yarns held to the back knit 1 in color a now bring both yarns forward and purl 1 in color b you have completed one stitch a pair remember repeat for all pairs to the last pair then purl the last pair together holding both colors on side b the leading color changes you are now knitting with color b and purling with color a when there is a color change within the pattern row you simply knit the first stitch of
